DisplayedItem.name: DI_19084
DisplayedItem.title: # For nodular (composite) ganglioneuroblastomas with more than 1 nodule, degree of differentiation and mitotic-karyorrhectic index (MKI) must be given for each nodule. Please indicate the differentiation and MKI for the least favorable nodule in the checklist below. Classification of additional nodules can be described in the comment.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_379671
DisplayedItem.title: Report neuroblastic component if not previously treated

DisplayedItem.title: Report neuroblastic component if not previously treated

Question.name: Q_10259
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Question.name: Q_52568
Question.title: ?International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC) (report if not previously treated) (Note H)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_36720
DisplayedItem.title: INPC applies to untreated primary tumors and tumors in metastatic sites provided that there is sufficient material to classify histologically. Classification based on limited material (biopsy or incomplete resection) may be subject to sampling error and should be noted, accordingly. Bone marrow biopsy is useful only for evaluation of degree of neuroblastic differentiation, but is not eligible for MKI determination.

Question.name: Q_19055
Question.title: ?MYCN Amplification Status (for all tumors except ganglioneuroma or post-therapy resection specimens) (Note L)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_19057
DisplayedItem.title: Results of MYCN amplification information may not be available to the pathologist at the time of the report.
